p: Insurance can protect agents (including firm owners) who are risk averse against financial losses in certain circumstances. For a harmful or loss-producing event to be ideally insurable, it should have the following characteristics: it should be generated by risky but independent events, the administrative cost of arranging insurance should be modest, and the provision of insurance should not change the insuredsâ€™ behavior. From this viewpoint, a program to pay real resources to develop vaccines for uncertain future diseases has some issues.
